new.headline: Partial Recovery of ongoing Service Degradation in West US region

content.excerpt_text: Impact Statement: Starting at 08:00 UTC on 07 February 2026, a subset of customers using Azure services in the West US region may experience intermittent service unavailability or delays in monitoring and log data for some resources hosted in the affected datacenter areas. source_payload.html:
Impact Statement: Starting at 08:00 UTC on 07 February 2026, a subset of customers using Azure services in the West US region may experience intermittent service unavailability or delays in monitoring and log data for some resources hosted in the affected datacenter areas. Impacted customers may observe degraded performance or delayed telemetry as services continue to recover.


Current Status: Earlier today, an unexpected interruption to utility power at one of our West US datacenters resulted in a loss of power to parts of the facility. Backup power systems were automatically activated, and power has since been stabilized across the affected areas.

Following the power event, some infrastructure components experienced temporary unavailability. Our engineers are actively working to restore full connectivity and to validate that services are operating normally. As part of the recovery, we are rebalancing traffic through Azureâ€™s software load balancing (SLB) layer and gradually reintroducing recovered infrastructure once health checks are validated. We continue to closely monitor service health and performance and will provide updates as recovery progresses.
